member.name: T:IVisTriggerTarget
member.summary: This interface should be used by any component that wants to be a target of a trigger. When set as a target of a trigger, OnTriggered will be called every time the trigger is triggered.

member.name: M:IVisTriggerTarget.OnTriggered(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function is called by the base trigger whenever this trigger has been TRIGGERED.
member.param: The current value of the targeted controller.
The previous value of the targeted controller.
The value difference of the targeted controller.

The adjusted value difference of the targeted controller. This value is the difference value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: T:VisDataContainer
member.summary: This class defines a data container for visualization data.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.average
member.summary: This indicates the average value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.previousAverage
member.summary: This indicates the previous average value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.averageDifference
member.summary: This indicates the difference of the average value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.median
member.summary: This indicates the median value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.previousMedian
member.summary: This indicates the previous median value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.medianDifference
member.summary: This indicates the difference of the median value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.sum
member.summary: This indicates the sum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.previousSum
member.summary: This indicates the previous sum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.sumDifference
member.summary: This indicates the difference of the sum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.minimum
member.summary: This indicates the minimum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.previousMinimum
member.summary: This indicates the previous minimum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.minimumDifference
member.summary: This indicates the difference of the minimum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.maximum
member.summary: This indicates the maximum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.previousMaximum
member.summary: This indicates the previous maximum value.

member.name: F:VisDataContainer.maximumDifference
member.summary: This indicates the difference of the maximum value.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.GetValue(VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the value based on type.
member.param: This type of value to get.
member.returns: The value that was requested.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.GetPreviousValue(VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the previous value based on type.
member.param: This type of previous value to get.
member.returns: The previous value that was requested.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.GetValueDifference(VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the value difference based on type.
member.param: This type of value difference to get.
member.returns: The value difference that was requested.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.UpdatePreviousValues
member.summary: This updates the previous value of this data container by setting the current value to the previous.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.ResetCurrentValues
member.summary: This resets all current values back to their default values.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.ApplyBoostAndCutoff(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This applies a boost and cutoff to all current values.
member.param: The boost to apply.
The cutoff to apply.

member.name: M:VisDataContainer.UpdateValueDifferences
member.summary: This updates all value differences by subtracting the current by the previous of each value type.

member.name: T:ControllerSourceValue
member.summary: This enumeration describes what value from the target controller should be used as the source value to modify a property.

member.name: F:ControllerSourceValue.Current
member.summary: This indicates the current value of the target controller.

member.name: F:ControllerSourceValue.Previous
member.summary: This indicates the previous value of the target controller.

member.name: F:ControllerSourceValue.Difference
member.summary: This indicates the difference value of the target controller.

member.name: T:VisHelper
member.summary: This static class is used to provide helper functions for Visualizer Studio.

member.name: M:VisHelper.Validate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This functon attempts to validiate a value.
member.param: The current value to validate.
The min valid value.
The max valid value.
The default value to use if the current value is invalid.
The object whose data is being validated.
The name of the field being validated.
Whether or not this is an error or warning if invalid.
member.returns: The new, validated value.

member.name: M:VisHelper.Validate(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This functon attempts to validiate a value.
member.param: The current value to validate.
The min valid value.
The max valid value.
The default value to use if the current value is invalid.
The object whose data is being validated.
The name of the field being validated.
Whether or not this is an error or warning if invalid.
member.returns: The new, validated value.

member.name: M:VisHelper.ConvertBetweenRanges(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function converts between a source range and a destination range based on the current source value. So given the following source and dest values... sourceValue=1.25, sourceMin=1.0, sourceMax=2.0, destMin=4.0, destMax=8.0 then... convertedValue=5.0
member.param: This is the current source value to convert from.
This is the minimum value for the source range to convert from.
This is the maximum value for the source range to convert from.
This is the minimum value for the dest range to convert to.
This is the maximum value for the dest range to convert to.
Indicates whether or not to invert to dest range result.
member.returns: The converted value.

member.name: T:IVisModifierTarget
member.summary: This interface should be used by any component that wants to be a target of a modifier. When set as a target of a modifier, OnValueUpdated will be called every time the value is updated.

member.name: M:IVisModifierTarget.OnValueUpdated(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function is called by the base modifier whenever the value of the targeted controller is updated.
member.param: The current value of the targeted controller.
The previous value of the targeted controller.
The value difference of the targeted controller.

The adjusted value difference of the targeted controller. This value is the difference value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: T:VisManager
member.summary: This class is the master object that controls all of the base visualization functionality.

member.name: F:VisManager.channel
member.summary: This is the audio channel to run the FFT on.

member.name: F:VisManager.windowSize
member.summary: This is the windows size to use when running the FFT.

member.name: F:VisManager.windowType
member.summary: This is the type of FFT window to run on the audio.

member.name: F:VisManager.audioSource
member.summary: This is the current audio source that is being used as the input audio signal.

member.name: F:VisManager.displaySpectrumDebug
member.summary: This indicates if the debugging information for the spectrum should be displayed.

member.name: F:VisManager.displayDataGroupDebug
member.summary: This indicates if the debugging information for the data groups should be displayed.

member.name: F:VisManager.displayControllerDebug
member.summary: This indicates if the debugging information for the controllers should be displayed.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugSpectrumBarWidth
member.summary: This is the pixel width to draw the spectrum bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugSpectrumBarHeight
member.summary: This is the maximum pixel height to draw the spectrum bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugRawAudioBarHeight
member.summary: This is the maximum pixel height to draw the raw audio bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugDataGroupBarWidth
member.summary: This is the pixel width to draw the data group bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugDataGroupBarHeight
member.summary: This is the maximum pixel height to draw the data group bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugControllerBarWidth
member.summary: This is the maximum bar width to draw the controller bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugControllerBarHeight
member.summary: This is the pixel height to draw the controller bars at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugSeparation
member.summary: This is the pixels of separation to draw the debug windows at.

member.name: F:VisManager.debugTexture
member.summary: This is the debug texture to use when drawing the debug frames. This should just be a plain white texture.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_afSpectrumData
member.summary: This is the array that holds all of the spectrum data for the current audio input. (This is the FFT results)

member.name: F:VisManager.m_afRawAudioData
member.summary: This is the array that holds all of the raw audio data for the current audio input. (This is raw wave form)

member.name: F:VisManager.m_afAuxiliaryData
member.summary: This is the array that holds the auxiliary audio data, used as temporary storage for merging left and right audio stream data.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_oDataGroups
member.summary: This is the list of data groups that are registered and active with this VisManager.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_oControllers
member.summary: This is the list of controllers that are registered and active with this VisManager.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_fMaxDebugValue
member.summary: This is the max displayed debug value.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_nFrequencyRange
member.summary: This is the range of the song frequency in Hz.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_fFrequencyResolution
member.summary: This is the size of each sample in Hz.

member.name: F:VisManager.m_bUseAudioListener
member.summary: This indicates whether or not this VisManager should use the static AudioListener.

member.name: M:VisManager.Reset
member.summary: This is called when the vis manager is reset.

member.name: M:VisManager.Start
member.summary: This function sets up this VisManager.

member.name: M:VisManager.SetAudioSource(UnityEngine.AudioSource)
member.summary: This function should be used to set the audio source at runtime. This will call Start() to reset the VisManager after calling.
member.param: The audio source to use for this VisManager.

member.name: M:VisManager.CalculateFrequencyResolution
member.summary: This calculates the current frequency range and resolution for the playing audio clip.

member.name: M:VisManager.Update
member.summary: This function updates this VisManager and runs the FFT on the target audio input, as well, it grabs the raw audio data.

member.name: M:VisManager.AddDataGroup(VisDataGroup)
member.summary: This adds a data group to this VisManager.
member.param: This is the data group to add.

member.name: M:VisManager.AddController(VisBaseController)
member.summary: This adds a controller to this VisManager.
member.param: This is the controller to add.

member.name: M:VisManager.RemoveDataGroup(VisDataGroup)
member.summary: This removes a data group to this VisManager.
member.param: This is the data group to remove.

member.name: M:VisManager.RemoveController(VisBaseController)
member.summary: This removes a controller to this VisManager.
member.param: This is the controller to remove.

member.name: M:VisManager.ClearDataGroups
member.summary: This clears all data groups on this manager.

member.name: M:VisManager.ClearControllers
member.summary: This clears all controllers on this manager.

member.name: M:VisManager.GetSpectrumData
member.summary: This gets the array of the spectrum data.
member.returns: The array of the spectrum data.

member.name: M:VisManager.GetRawAudioData
member.summary: This gets the array of the raw audio data.
member.returns: This is the array of the raw audio data.

member.name: M:VisManager.GetDataGroupByName(System.String)
member.summary: This gets a data group from this VisManager by name.
member.param: The name of the data group to find.
member.returns: The data group that was requested. Returns null if not found.

member.name: M:VisManager.GetControllerByName(System.String)
member.summary: This gets a controller from this VisManager by name.
member.param: The name of the controller to find.
member.returns: The controller that was requested. Returns null if not found.

member.name: M:VisManager.EnsureUniqueControllerName(System.String)
member.summary: This ensures a controller name is unique.
member.param: The current name to modify.

member.name: M:VisManager.EnsureUniqueDataGroupName(System.String)
member.summary: This ensures a data group name is unique.
member.param: The current name to modify.

member.name: M:VisManager.OnGUI
member.summary: This function displays the debug GUI for this VisManager.

member.name: M:VisManager.GetDebugColor(System.Int32,VisDataSource)
member.summary: This gets the debug gui color for a specific frequency index
member.param: This is the frequency index used to lookup the debug color.
The data source.
member.returns: This returns the debug color to be used to display the requested frequency index.

member.name: M:VisManager.ToString
member.summary: To string function.
member.returns: This object as a string.

member.name: M:VisManager.RestoreVisManagerTarget(IVisManagerTarget)
member.summary: This attempts to restore the last set manager on the target.
member.param: The target to restore.
member.returns: Whether or not the target was restored.

member.name: P:VisManager.DataGroups
member.summary: This gets the read only list of all data groups in this VisManager.

member.name: P:VisManager.Controllers
member.summary: This gets the read only list of all controllers in this VisManager.

member.name: P:VisManager.FrequencyResolution
member.summary: This gets the size of each sample in Hz.

member.name: T:VisManager.Defaults
member.summary: This internal class holds all of the defaults of the VisManager class.

member.name: T:VisManager.WindowSize
member.summary: This enumeration describes the target window size to use for running the FFT.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._64
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 64.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._128
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 128.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._256
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 256.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._512
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 512.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._1024
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 1024.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._2048
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 2048.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._4096
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 4096.

member.name: F:VisManager.WindowSize._8192
member.summary: Indicates a window size of 8192.

member.name: T:VisManager.Channel
member.summary: This enumeration describes the target channel to run the FFT on.

member.name: F:VisManager.Channel.Left
member.summary: Indicates the left audio channel.

member.name: F:VisManager.Channel.Right
member.summary: Indicates the right audio channel.

member.name: F:VisManager.Channel.Average
member.summary: Indicates the average of the left and right audio channels.

member.name: F:VisManager.Channel.Min
member.summary: Indicates the minimum of the left and right audio channels.

member.name: F:VisManager.Channel.Max
member.summary: Indicates the maximum of the left and right audio channels.

member.name: T:IVisManagerTarget
member.summary: This interface is used by objects that need to target a VisManager.

member.name: P:IVisManagerTarget.Manager
member.summary: This gets/sets the vis manager for this interface.

member.name: P:IVisManagerTarget.LastManagerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last manager that was set to this target.

member.name: T:VisDataValueType
member.summary: This enumeration defines what type of value a data group uses, i.e. how it is calculated.

member.name: F:VisDataValueType.Average
member.summary: This indicates that the average of all values should be used.

member.name: F:VisDataValueType.Median
member.summary: This indicates that the median/middle of all values should be used.

member.name: F:VisDataValueType.Sum
member.summary: This indicates that the sum of all values should be used.

member.name: F:VisDataValueType.Minimum
member.summary: This indicates that the minimum of all values should be used.

member.name: F:VisDataValueType.Maximum
member.summary: This indicates that the maximum of all values should be used.

member.name: T:VisDataSource
member.summary: This enumeration indicates what the data source of a data group should be.

member.name: F:VisDataSource.Raw
member.summary: This indicates that the raw audio wave data should be used.

member.name: F:VisDataSource.Spectrum
member.summary: This indicates that the spectrum data (the FFT result) should be used.

member.name: T:VisDataGroup
member.summary: This class encapsulates a section of the raw or spectrum data of the audio being played back in order to aggregate the data in that section in various ways.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.m_oVisManager
member.summary: This is the vis manager that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.m_szLastVisManagerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last manager that was set to this base modifier

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.dataGroupName
member.summary: This is the name of this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.dataSource
member.summary: This is the source of the data for this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.numberSubDataGroups
member.summary: This indicates the number of times the target spectrum range should be split up into small sub groups for aggregating the data.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.frequencyRangeStartIndex
member.summary: This is the start index of the target spectrum range of this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.frequencyRangeEndIndex
member.summary: This is the end index of the target spectrum range of this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.boost
member.summary: This is the scalar amount to apply to the data values of this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.cutoff
member.summary: This is the maximum cutoff value to to the data values of this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.debugColor
member.summary: This is the debug color to use for this data group.

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.m_aoDataContainers
member.summary: This array contains a data container for each VisDataValueType. It is split up this way so that it is possible to get the "Sum" of all sub data groups "Average". Other examples would be the following: "Median of the Sums", "Minimum of the Maximums", "Sum of the Sums", etc

member.name: F:VisDataGroup.m_oSubDataGroups
member.summary: This list contains all of the sub data groups that define this data group. The data group is split up into component parts in order to allow more granular aggregation of the visualization data.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.Reset
member.summary: This resets this data group to all default values.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.Awake
member.summary: This function is called when this data group is awoken, it is used to make sure it is registered with its target data group.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.Start
member.summary: This is called when this data group is started.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.OnDestroy
member.summary: This function is called when this data group is destroyed. It makes sure that this data group is removed from its vis manager.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.ValidateManager(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This validates the manager for this data group, ensuring it is in the same game object as this one.
member.param: Indicates if a warning should be displayed.
member.returns: Returns whether or not the manager is valid

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.EnsureRegistered
member.summary: This function makes sure that this data group is registered with its vis manager.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.Update
member.summary: This is the main update function

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.GetValue(VisDataValueType,VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the value of this data group, based on the value types.
member.param: This is the value type of the final part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
This is the value type of the sub data part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
member.returns: This is the final value that was requested

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.GetPreviousValue(VisDataValueType,VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the previous value of this data group, based on the value types.
member.param: This is the value type of the final part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
This is the value type of the sub data part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
member.returns: This is the final value that was requested

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.GetValueDifference(VisDataValueType,VisDataValueType)
member.summary: This gets the value difference of this data group, based on the value types.
member.param: This is the value type of the final part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
This is the value type of the sub data part of this value. i.e. The maximum (finalValueType) of the average (subValueType) of all sub data groups.
member.returns: This is the final value that was requested.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.DisplayDebugGUI(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Texture)
member.summary: This displays the debug information of this data group.
member.param: The x location to display this data group.
The y location to display this data group.
This is the width in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the height in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the separation in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the texture used to display the debug information.
member.returns: This is the rect of the of the debug information that was displayed.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.ToString
member.summary: This gets the string representation of this data group.
member.returns: The string of this data group.

member.name: M:VisDataGroup.RestoreVisDataGroupTarget(IVisDataGroupTarget)
member.summary: This attempts to restore the last set data group on the target.
member.param: The target to restore.
member.returns: Whether or not the target was restored.

member.name: P:VisDataGroup.Manager
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target manager for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisDataGroup.LastManagerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last manager that was set to this target.

member.name: T:VisDataGroup.Defaults
member.summary: This internal class holds all of the defaults of the VisDataGroup class.

member.name: T:IVisDataGroupTarget
member.summary: This interface is used to mark a class as being able to target a data group.

member.name: P:IVisDataGroupTarget.DataGroup
member.summary: This gets/sets the data group.

member.name: P:IVisDataGroupTarget.LastDataGroupName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last data group that was set to this target.

member.name: T:VisBaseController
member.summary: This is the base class for all controllers. Controllers are used to pull a single scalar piece of data from a data group, to be used to modify or trigger objects in the scene.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime
member.summary: This is the amount of time that the input values should act as if they changed in. For instance, if the value went up 0.1f in 0.05f seconds, the following would be the used value: adjustedChange = ((1.0f / 0.05f) * 0.1f) / mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_oVisManager
member.summary: This is the vis manager that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_szLastVisManagerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last manager that was set to this base modifier

member.name: F:VisBaseController.controllerName
member.summary: This is the name of this controller.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.limitIncreaseRate
member.summary: This indicates if the increase rate of this controllers values should be limited.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.increaseRate
member.summary: This is the rate at which the value of this controller can increase per second.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.limitDecreaseRate
member.summary: This indicates if the decrease rate of this controllers values should be limited.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.decreaseRate
member.summary: This is the rate at which the value of this controller can decrease per second.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fPreviousValue
member.summary: This is the value of this controller from the previous frame.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fValue
member.summary: This is the current value of this controller.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fValueDifference
member.summary: This is the difference of the current value and the previous value.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fAdjustedValueDifference
member.summary: This is the ADJUSTED difference of the current value and the previous value. The adjusted value is the change of the value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fMinValue
member.summary: This is the minimum value that this controller has ever been set to.

member.name: F:VisBaseController.m_fMaxValue
member.summary: This is the maximum value that this controller has ever beens set to.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.Reset
member.summary: This function resets this controller to default values

member.name: M:VisBaseController.Awake
member.summary: This is called when this component is woken up.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.Start
member.summary: The main start function.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.OnDestroy
member.summary: This is called when this controller is destroyed.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.ValidateManager(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This validates the manager for this controller, ensuring it is in the same game object as this one.
member.param: Indicates if a warning should be displayed.
member.returns: Returns whether or not the manager is valid

member.name: M:VisBaseController.EnsureRegistered
member.summary: This function makes sure that this controller is registered with its vis manager.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.Update
member.summary: This updates this controller. This should not be overridden! To implement custom controller functionality, override GetCustomControllerValue().

member.name: M:VisBaseController.GetCustomControllerValue
member.summary: This function returns the current value for this controller. TO IMPLEMENT A CUSTOM CONTROLLER, override this function to return the current target value.
member.returns: The custom controller value.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.GetCurrentValue
member.summary: This gets the current value of this controller.
member.returns: The current value.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.GetPreviousValue
member.summary: This gets the previous value of this controller.
member.returns: The previous value.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.GetValueDifference
member.summary: This gets the value difference of this controller.
member.returns: The value difference.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.GetAdjustedValueDifference
member.summary: This gets the adjusted value difference of this controller.
member.returns: The adjusted value difference.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.DisplayDebugGUI(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UnityEngine.Texture)
member.summary: This displays the debug information of this controller.
member.param: The x location to display this data group.
The y location to display this data group.
This is the width in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the height in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the separation in pixels of the debug bars.
This is the texture used to display the debug information.
member.returns: This is the rect of the of the debug information that was displayed.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.ToString
member.summary: This gets the string representation of this controller.
member.returns: The string of this data group.

member.name: M:VisBaseController.RestoreVisBaseControllerTarget(IVisBaseControllerTarget)
member.summary: This attempts to restore the last set controller on the target.
member.param: The target to restore.
member.returns: Whether or not the target was restored.

member.name: P:VisBaseController.Manager
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target manager for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisBaseController.LastManagerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last manager that was set to this target.

member.name: P:VisBaseController.MinValue
member.summary: This gets the minimum value that this controller has ever been set to.

member.name: P:VisBaseController.MaxValue
member.summary: This gets the maximum value that this controller has ever been set to.

member.name: T:VisBaseController.Defaults
member.summary: This internal class holds all of the defaults of the VisBaseController class.

member.name: T:IVisBaseControllerTarget
member.summary: This interface is used to mark a class as being able to target a controller.

member.name: P:IVisBaseControllerTarget.Controller
member.summary: This gets/sets the controller.

member.name: P:IVisBaseControllerTarget.LastControllerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last controller that was set to this target.

member.name: T:IVisPrefabSpawnedTarget
member.summary: This interface is used to notify prefabs/objects that are spawned by the VisSpawnPrefabTrigger object, and to feed into them the current controller state.

member.name: M:IVisPrefabSpawnedTarget.OnSpawned(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function is called by VisSpawnPrefabTrigger when it spawns a prefab.
member.param: The current value of the associated controller.
The previous value of the associated controller.
The value difference of the associated controller.

The adjusted value difference of the targeted controller. This value is the difference value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: T:VisSubDataGroup
member.summary: This class is a sub data group that belongs to a parent data group. It is used to help aggregate data for a data group.

member.name: F:VisSubDataGroup.frequencyRangeStartIndex
member.summary: This is the start frequency index of this sub data group.

member.name: F:VisSubDataGroup.frequencyRangeEndIndex
member.summary: This is the end frequency index of this sub data group.

member.name: M:VisSubDataGroup.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The start frequency index.
This end frequency index.

member.name: M:VisSubDataGroup.Update(System.Single[])
member.summary: This is the main update function of this sub data group, uses to aggregate the data for this sub data group.
member.param: This is the current spectrum data to update against.

member.name: T:VisBaseTrigger
member.summary: This class is a base class for all triggers. Triggers are scripts that target a controller, and can trigger events in the game, based on input from its target controller.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.m_oVisManager
member.summary: This is the vis manager that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.m_szLastVisManagerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last manager that was set to this base modifier

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.controller
member.summary: This is the controller that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.m_szLastControllerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last controller that was set to this base modifier

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.triggerType
member.summary: This describes the type of this trigger. (i.e. How it functions)

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.triggerThreshold
member.summary: This is the threshold at which the trigger should activate, based on the current Trigger Type.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.triggerReactivateDelay
member.summary: This is the amount of time to wait in between consecutive triggers of this trigger.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.triggerRandomReactivateDelay
member.summary: This is the amount of random delay to add to the reactivate time. Random range from "-value" to "value"

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.m_fTriggerDelayTimer
member.summary: This is the timer used to control the trigger reactivate delay.

member.name: M:VisBaseTrigger.Reset
member.summary: This function is called when this trigger is reset. Should be overriden by sub classes to reset variables to their default values.

member.name: M:VisBaseTrigger.Start
member.summary: This function is called when this trigger is started. Should be override by sub classes to initialize.

member.name: M:VisBaseTrigger.OnDestroy
member.summary: This function is called when this trigger is destroyed. Should be override by sub classes to handle destruction.

member.name: M:VisBaseTrigger.Update
member.summary: This updates this modifier using the default methods. This can be overriden to implement custom triggering criteria.

member.name: M:VisBaseTrigger.OnTriggered(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function is called by the trigger whenever this trigger has been TRIGGERED. TO IMPLEMENT A CUSTOM TRIGGER REACTION, override this function to handle the trigger event.
member.param: The current value of the targeted controller.
The previous value of the targeted controller.
The value difference of the targeted controller.

The adjusted value difference of the targeted controller. This value is the difference value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: P:VisBaseTrigger.Manager
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target manager for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisBaseTrigger.LastManagerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last manager that was set to this target.

member.name: P:VisBaseTrigger.Controller
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target controller for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisBaseTrigger.LastControllerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last controller that was set to this target.

member.name: T:VisBaseTrigger.Defaults
member.summary: This internal class holds all of the defaults of the VisBaseTrigger class.

member.name: T:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType
member.summary: This enumeration indicates how this trigger is activated.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType.None
member.summary: This indicates no default triggering and it must be triggered by custom functionality.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType.LessThanValueThreshold
member.summary: This indicates that this trigger is triggered when the associated controllers value goes under the specified threshold.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType.GreaterThanValueThreshold
member.summary: This indicates that this trigger is triggered when the associated controllers value goes over the specified threshold.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType.LessThanChangeThreshold
member.summary: This indicates that this trigger is triggered when the associated controllers value difference/change goes under the specified threshold.

member.name: F:VisBaseTrigger.TriggerType.GreaterThanChangeThreshold
member.summary: This indicates that this trigger is triggered when the associated controllers value difference/change goes over the specified threshold.

member.name: T:VisBaseModifier
member.summary: This class is a base class for all modifiers. Modifiers are scripts that target a controller, and can modify game objects over time.

member.name: F:VisBaseModifier.m_oVisManager
member.summary: This is the vis manager that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisBaseModifier.m_szLastVisManagerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last manager that was set to this base modifier

member.name: F:VisBaseModifier.controller
member.summary: This is the controller that this modifier is targeting.

member.name: F:VisBaseModifier.m_szLastControllerName
member.summary: This is the name of the last controller that was set to this base modifier

member.name: M:VisBaseModifier.Reset
member.summary: This function is called when this modifier is reset. Should be overriden by sub classes to reset variables to their default values.

member.name: M:VisBaseModifier.Start
member.summary: This function is called when this modifier is started. Should be override by sub classes to initialize.

member.name: M:VisBaseModifier.OnDestroy
member.summary: This function is called when this modifier is destroyed. Should be override by sub classes to handle destruction.

member.name: M:VisBaseModifier.Update
member.summary: This updates this modifier. This should not be overridden! To implement custom modifier functionality, override OnValueUpdated().

member.name: M:VisBaseModifier.OnValueUpdated(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This function is called by the base modifier whenever the value of the targeted controller is updated. TO IMPLEMENT A CUSTOM MODIFIER, override this function to handle the value being updated.
member.param: The current value of the targeted controller.
The previous value of the targeted controller.
The value difference of the targeted controller.

The adjusted value difference of the targeted controller. This value is the difference value as if it took place over a certain time period, controlled by VisBaseController.mc_fTargetAdjustedDifferenceTime. The default of this essientially indicates a frame rate of 60 fps to determine the adjusted difference. This should be used for almost all difference calculations, as it is NOT frame rate dependent.

member.name: P:VisBaseModifier.Manager
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target manager for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisBaseModifier.LastManagerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last manager that was set to this target.

member.name: P:VisBaseModifier.Controller
member.summary: This property gets/sets the target controller for this modifier.

member.name: P:VisBaseModifier.LastControllerName
member.summary: This gets the name of the last controller that was set to this target.

member.name: T:VisBaseModifier.Defaults
member.summary: This internal class holds all of the defaults of the VisBaseModifier class.
